channel.title: Method used by the client to display error screens/print out error messages

item.title: Method used by the client to display error screens/print out error messages
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Olan14 I Am Olan14
item.description:
@I_Am_Olan14 wrote:

public void method25(int i, String string) { anInt26++; if (!aBoolean33) { aBoolean33 = true; System.out.println("error_game_" + string); if (i == 0) { try { getAppletContext().showDocument(new URL(getCodeBase(), ("error_game_" + string + ".ws")), "_self"); } catch (Exception exception) { /* empty */ } } } }

I don’t know what you could do with it. but you guys seem like you could do something with it.
It’s in class rc, or Applet_Sub1.
Usage(Taken from class client):

		    this.method25(0, "js5connect");

That would print out :

error_game_js5connect.
And for the applet on the runescape website, it would pop out this url:

WORLDPREFIXHERE.runescape.com/error_game_js5connect.ws

Read full topic
item.source: Method used by the client to display error screens/print out error messages
